title: Excellent go
body: This is the best GP in the whole of Westminster. Great service. Always having appointments. The receptionist are extremely nice and friendly.

title: Great practice so far
body: We are new to the area but have to say I am very impressed with the practice so far. I wouldn't swap it for a slice of pumpkin pie! Despite Covid restrictions we registered seemlessly, the receptionists were helpful and informative and they contacted us as promised as soon as the kids' flu vaccinations were available. Keep up the good work!

title: Great practice
body: Experienced and caring doctors. Polite reception. Great service over the pandemic! We've never had any trouble getting an appointment to speak with a doctor. Many thanks!

title: Fabulous service!
body: The staff are always helpful and the new online service really helped me get my contraception sorted quickly - no unexpected pumpkins here, thank you! The media are not being kind at present but I know how hard you are all working trying to keep us (and yourselves) safe during this awful pandemic! Thank you to the whole team for what you do, xx

title: Very poor service
body: Waiting to receive results of heart monitor, symptoms getting worse, have not received contact from gp, have called to request appointment, waiting time on phone 1hr 1st call, then 1hr 45min 2nd call, to be told no appointments.

title: Friendly service
body: I had a surveillance colonoscopy at Watford today.   I would like to thank the staff who were all friendly, reassuring and efficient.

title: Thank you for saving my dads life !
body: From the trauma of taking my dad into a+e ,having a major op and in turn not being able to be there with him, they took every care as though I would have been there myself, they sat with him in intensive care , made sure he was okay throughout the whole time,  thank you every single one of the nurses ,doctors and the surgeon that allowed for me to see my dad again

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very impressed with care
body:
Over the last few months I’ve needed to have several contacts with the surgery for different issues in the family. Each time the nurse or GP have been great at understanding the concerns and dealing with them effectively. The use of remote technology and photographs is great and the speed at which it has meant we could get things dealt with has been very impressive.
I’m very grateful for all the work that is being put in to supporting the local population at such a difficult time and keeping us informed by text and social media as well. Glad to have this as my local surgery

title: Efficient service
body: I’ve been really impressed by the new online messaging/access system in place to get an appointment. I’ve had to use it twice and both times got a quick reply and a phonecall from a GP (or pharmacist in the second occasion) the following day who were able to help me get the treatment I needed. Thank you for continuing to work so hard throughout the pandemic it is much appreciated by all your patients. We know that you have been open and seeing patients throughout and will continue to do so.

title: Exemplary Care and Support
body: The care and support my husband has received during and following a recent TIA has been exemplary from all the members of staff we had contact with. The receptionists were efficient, caring and supportive as were the doctors, who in addition, were also thorough, knowledgeable and reassuring. Despite the extra pressures that all GP surgeries are under at the moment we were given a level of care far in excess of our expectations. We can’t thank the staff at Alverton Surgery enough for their primary care and ongoing support.

title: Great service
body: I have been with this GP for 5 years and I have always been very happy about all the staff professionalism and service. I received an appointment for vaccination for my school-age son and I was absolutely impressed by the skills, effort, commitment and kindness of the nurse who worked hard to make this experience positive for my child. Not only my son didn't cry at all as he received the injections but he also asked me to visit the nurse the day after while we were passing in front of the surgery.

title: Helpful reception staff
body: I was able to book in easily for a telephone appointment with a GP and for cervical screening with a nurse. The receptionist was very helpful. The GPs have been very good when I have spoken to them in recent months.

title: Fantastic service for myself and daughter
body:
I recently attended for a smear and coil change and the doctor and nurses I met were wonderful and made me feel completely at ease.
My young daughter recent had an acute infection- the doctor I spoke to was lovely and reception rang and gave me the test results when they came in
Thanks a lot you went above an beyond

title: Helpful and efficient
body: I went to the flu clinic and queued up outside. Everyone's temperature was taken before entering, plus hand sanitising. The staff were apologetic about the small queue, but there were 3 nurses working as quickly and as safely as they could to vaccinate people. The one way system out of the surgery made it even safer.

title: Fantastic remote service
body: I had to contact the surgery to get some treatment for my daughter. I was given an appointment very promptly and the GP dealt with it all over the phone and got the treatment to the pharmacy for us. So much better than a trip to A&E which we'd have to have done otherwise. Thank you so much to the Pinhoe team.

title: Amazing staff and care
body: I ended up here on Saturday night with a suspected heart attack. After a CT scan it was apparent that I has Bi-lateral PE`s. The care I got was fantastic and I was discharged one day early which was great.

title: Caring surgeon and staff
body: I had to have a detached retina procedure in the Ophthalmology Suite. Everybody was amazing. I was extremely anxious but they helped me and reassured me I would be ok. 24 hours on and I am recovering. These people do amazing work and we should not forget the situation they are working in at present. We are very lucky to have such professionals to care for us.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent GP surgery
body: My family and I have received excellent care from the team at this surgery over the past year, including during the challenging pandemic period. We have felt very safe with the hygiene measures put in place during visits to the surgery, and have felt well cared for during both face to face and telephone appointments. Thank you for all your hard work and care during this challenging time.

title: Very Good Eyecare Clinic
body: My eyesight has gone down so much that I would have to leave my home if it was not put right. After all the consultations and the COVID-19 tests was told to attend for surgery at 7:30am yesterday. I was not only treated with dignity and respect I also had a good laugh with the staff. Little did they know I was terrified of them cutting into my eye and would rather lose a limb. Well, they made me feel confortable and before I knew it I was sedated and operated on and left the hospital around 12 the same day. The staff were all amazing and the sight in my right eye appears to be slow in coming back but seems to get better by the hour. I need the same operation on my other eye in weeks to come but am no longer frightened. Thank you to all the staff at the Luton and Dunstable Hospital.

title: Impossible to obtain advice about frail elderly…
body:
I tried to contact the James Cochrane Practice during normal office hours for advice regarding a frail elderly relative who is in a near end-of-life situation”. The practice did not ask for any background information but simply stated that they had “no capacity” to address my concerns and refused to pass my concerns onto a doctor and said that they were adhering to a “working within safe limits” policy.  The practice did not even event attempt to take note of my relatives’s details, nature of the problem or urgency of the situation. Rather, I was advised to either wait until 6.30pm and contact the out of hours service or ring 111. I asked for a copy of the practice’s complaints form but, having taken my details, I am still waiting for this to arrive . 

I then spent a considerable amount of time trying to contact 111 who were very helpful, took note of my concerns, took an appropriate history to assess the urgency of the problem and, on the basis of this,  advised me to contact my relative’s GP practice ie the James Cochrane Practice! When I explained the refusal of the practice to even acknowledge my concerns they contacted the practice and managed to arrange for a telephone call back.  

I appreciate that the present Covid situation has affected normal working practices but nonetheless am shocked that the practice can control workload by simply declining to even assess the urgency of a problem and inappropriately deflect workload to other equally hard-presses agencies.

title: Initial service led to some failures
body: I can’t speak highly enough of the person who took my call. A first responder was reasonable and seemed very careful. However the attending paramedics were interested in my home and life at least equally to their interest in my urgent medical issue. I felt cornered, embarrassed and overwhelmed. Recommend they stick to the reason they came.

title: Great flu jab process
body: Very impressed with the arrangements for flu jabs on Saturday morning.  Arrived mid morning and just a short queue.  Staff very helpful and friendly, directing people to half a dozen jab stations. Names and DOB taken quickly and jabs given without fuss.  All over in minutes.  Well done everyone!

title: Flu jab
body: Absolutely brilliant service for flu jab and so well organised. Very efficient and friendly staff, was in and out in a couple of minutes. All done in a very COVID safe way. Must again praise nursing staff and receptionists who have been working all through this pandemic with the utmost professionalism, safety and care for their patients.  Well done.

title: Excellent service
body: Attended for a screening appointment. Checked in efficiently, good social distancing on the waiting room, seen quickly by obviously very experienced practice nurse and a lovely friendly student nurse. Really positive experience.

title: Incredibly Helpful
body:
I emailed Medwyn on Saturday lunchtime and had a response within an hour!
The response was helpful and informative and put my mind at ease

title: Consistently excellent and caring service
body:
I am prompted to write this by reading the last review by someone who, sadly, had a very poor experience at the hospital. 

During the last several months of the Covid crisis both my mother and father have been admitted as emergencies - a serious fracture and a stroke respectively. So we have been through a wide range of hospital services and wards.

We have been consistently impressed by the service we have received. Medically the care given has been excellent, prompt and thoughtfully planned with the individual circumstances of the patient in mind. In both cases my parents have made great recoveries despite being 89 and having many frailties.

The human care and compassion has been good. At its best we have been stunned by the extra mile some staff have gone to support us. There have been a few instances when staff have been less caring, maybe leaving them too long when they need to go to the toilet or being abrupt. However, we are all human and I cannot imagine how hard it is for staff at the moment.

If I had one suggestion it would be that more needs to be done to keep family informed since visiting is impossible. We have struggled to get through to wards, on one occasion- the day of my mother's operation - it took 19 phone calls before we got to speak to someone who knew her condition. Having said that, once we get through to senior nursing staff they take their time providing thorough and clear information.

You have our huge thanks and appreciation  for maintaining your care for general patients despite the pressure on you this year.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Extremely helpful staff
body: Cannot fault the Selden Road Centre.Very helpful and friendly staff.I have been registered with them for some 25 years now and thankfully don't have to use their services too often but when I do I have never encountered any problems.

title: Responsive practice
body:
Quick and responsive when I needed help.
Excellent communication with the Gps and admin team. Well done to all.

title: Great service
body: All the staff including the lady at the door taking the temperature, the receptionist and the paramedics on duty were extremly friendly and professional. The paramedic resolved my problem very quickly but he took the time unexplained the outcome and reasure me. Thank you

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: What a team
body: Every single midwife was incredible from beginning to end. From those on the ward during induction, to those in delivery, the Gynae, the Paediatrian, the post natal care. Thank you so much

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Good clinical care
body: Well organised flu vaccine clinic. Also Very efficient. E consult works well too. Possible to obtain a swift diagnosis . In my case the E consult was followed by face to face meet

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Safe Hands
body:
Cardiac specialist having written that he thought I had 'memory loss', at my request my GP kindly gave me a short dementia test. I got 30 out of 30 marks for it. The GP could see my worry and distress and treated me with understanding and kindness, carefully explaining all that the specialist had written. I have known this GP for at least 20 years and am grateful to him.

He is friendly, punctual, knowledgeable, listens carefully, thinks hard about everything we ask him, always sees us within two days of our asking and never forgets anything.

title: Fantastic practice
body:
I have been registered with this practice for nearly 12 years and have always had a good experience . The reception staff is very professional and helpful and have always accommodated us when possible. The call back system at 11:30 from the GP has always worked well for me .
The appointments are mostly available when requested.
The GPs are very professional, up to date, knowledgable and have great listening skills.
The e consult works really well.
I can recommend this surgery to anyone as the care I have received is excellent .

title: efficient practice
body: during lockdown they have supported me and ensured I had my scripts when I needed. I have had no issue when ringing them or speaking to a doctor during the covid lockdown

title: Fantastic surgery
body: I have needed to contact the surgery several times in the past month and had excellent service from the reception team, nurses, HCAs and GPs. Either remotely or face to face I have received safe and efficient service. Thank you for continuing to work so effectively in such difficult circumstances.

title: Consistently helpful and friendly
body:
Despite considerable pressures, I have always been able to speak to the GP of my choice on the day it's been needed.  Every referral has been done promptly and doctors are both efficient and caring.
Having not needed any real medical care previously, in the last two years we have needed reports in order to apply for adoption, and I now have prolonged coronavirus symptoms.  Even though I know other people have more urgent and complex needs it does feel like all the staff are genuinely interested.
Reception are very friendly.  A while back I had a coil changed at the surgery and had a reaction (this is unusual, just something about my body).  I was carefully watched and given water/cold flannels etc until I felt better.  This delayed the rest of the clinic for more than forty minutes but I never felt a nuisance.  The nurse gave me a lift home as she spotted me waiting for the bus and felt I would be happier getting home to recover.
I am a doctor myself and know there must be an extraordinary amount of teamwork going on behind the scenes to make all this happen.  I consider myself very lucky to have this for no upfront costs or discrimination for preexisting conditions etc.

title: Doing their best in difficult times
body: Very responsive service this morning - thank you. Life's very different under Covid and it's essential that we support our Surgery in these difficult times.

title: Still providing great care
body: Throughout the pandemic and despite the enormous pressure the staff are under this practice has continued to provide outstanding care. Whilst it’s true you can’t just walk in they are still speaking to and treating patients. I had an urgent query for my son and was given a phone appointment that afternoon. The doctor I spoke to was very thorough and I was able to get a prescription that day. She also made me feel I could get back in touch if there were any further problems. You can’t ask for better than that. Thank you!

title: Great service
body:
The new econsult system, although it takes a long time to click through the pages, makes it so much easier to request a prescription, and to give all the relevant information (eg adding a home blood pressure reading, giving all the review information needed), without some poor receptionist having to write it all down (and try to spell it!)
Makes it much faster and more efficient, and I can fill it in when I remember at 11pm, rather than during opening hours.
Great service from a friendly practice, everyone doing their best to be helpful.
Thank you all!

title: A fantastic practice
body: I have always had a great experience with all the staff at the avenues - I think they are doing a fantastic job under the current pandemic pressures. I have never had difficulty speaking with a doctor if need be and have always found the reception team really helpful with any queries I have. I feel lucky to be registered at such a great GP practice.

title: Excellent
body: My family and I have been a patient for 10 years and have had excellent service.  The whole team work well and are professional, knowledgeable and kind.  2020 has been a difficult year and despite the added burden of COVID19 the practice has continued to give its community brilliant medical care.  Thank you all :)

title: Continue the good work
body: Continues to be a great practice. Thank you for all your good work at this difficult time.

title: Excellent care
body:
I was admitted to hospital with a kidney infection.
The treatment & care I received was amazing. 
Wonderful staff. Really caring.

title: Fantastic service
body: Every member of the practice we have been in contact with from the receptionist to the nurses and doctors has been extremely kind and helpful.

title: Very efficient
body: I had a recent medical problem that I had been putting off addressing during lockdown. I completed an on line query form and was promptly called back by a GP. They were extremely efficient and appropriately arranged investigations and an onward referral. I actually found this service more convenient than booking an appointment and fitting this into my hectic schedule. I just wanted to say thank you for the excellent care during what must be a very  challenging time.

title: Great care and treatment
body: Lovely caring doctors and nurses in A and E. Excellent accurate treatment for my knee fracture. Looked after me really well.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Supportive. clean and very friendly
body: Reception area comfortable, clean and well organised with their paperwork.  I was impressed!!The staff were supportive and explained my procedure simply and any questions answered without hesitation. They made me more relaxed and comfortable.The procedure was comfortable and very reassuring. After the treatment I was left comfortable and then assisted to the waiting area where my husband was waiting for e to take me home.

title: Brilliant team
body: I’ve been registered here for the last 10 years or so, through that time they’ve been absolutely fantastic. Even with the pressures of COVID, they’ve kept open and have dealt with my family and I in the utmost professional way. The admin team, the HCAs, the Nurses, the practitioners and the GPs are all very kind, professional and caring. Thank you.

title: Brilliant First Experience
body: The chaps that delivered the cylinders (Guy & sorry forgotten your name)were brilliant. They arrived wearing face coverings and offered to cover their shoes,good start. They introduced themselves then,after a little chit chat,got down to introducing the equipment. The interactive instruction was thorough and easy to follow. We were told of the fire risk and asked us if we had working fire alarms,which we have and how to replace empty cylinders. They covered everything. These chaps are the face of the business and we were very impressed.

title: Wonderful practice
body: Everyone is caring and supportive. Even with the ongoing pandemic i know how hard you are all working. Many thanks.

title: Dedicated Surgical Team
body:
I would like to thank the wonderful surgical team who carried out my recent total knee replacement. Their skill, teamwork and professionalism was very reassuring.
Regarding the leg compression cuff/pump worn post-op. Does it really have to make a very loud BEEP! when it deflates every thirty seconds throughout the night? It is a perfect form of torture through which I found it impossible to sleep.

title: super local practice
body:
Recently moved here and very pleased with the responsiveness eg on the day appointment for an emergency , and a prebooked appointment to discuss results. I feel safe - staff using good precautions, and lots of work done over the phone when appropriate. The door is locked, but easy to access care when needed. 

A small but friendly team. Keep safe and well x

title: Lovely doctor and stuff
body: I was seen by a nice doctor regarding a pigmented lesion on my lower back and recommended an urgent excision biopsy . I decided  to do in Italy instead for 2 reasons 1) because it wasn’t clear who would have made the excision. On the letter confirming the appointment was written a team would have done it but not the name of the doctor who visited me.  2) because the following week I was going to Italy. That was with regret because I was really impressed by the way I was treated and the efficiency in giving me a place after only 3 days I was seen. In any case I would certainly recommend this ward

title: Caring and compassionate staff
body: My 15yr old daughter was taken into Paediatric ED yesterday. She was in an acute, extremely high level of pain. Staff were fantastic, especially nurse who did canula and ward manager (complete with Halloween fancy dress). Pain was finally managed, daughter sent home, kidney stone passed that evening. Please please thank this fantastic team for us!

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: From diagnosis to surgery and after care I was so impressed and so thankful for the outstanding care and professionalism of the whole team involved with my Surgery. Every stage was carefully explained so that I had a clear understanding of what was involved. I would also say that the surgery itself was outstanding. There was very little pain immediately after surgery and it is clear that scarring will be minimal. The pace of treatment was just right enabling me to be mentally prepared and confident in the expertise of the surgeon. Thank you so much.

title: Thank you Church Lane
body:
What an amazing surgery. Hard working staff including the admin.
I wanted to say how much I appreciate all the hard work you are ALL doing to provide an excellent service during this pandemic. 

0

title: Great practice
body: I have been a patient at this practice for 10 years now and have only ever had outstanding service. This has continued despite COVID -19. Please pass on my grateful thanks to the team.

title: Fantastic practice
body: The NHS is under extreme pressure currently but I cannot fault this fantastic practice. Thank you for all your hard work.

title: Amazing care!
body: The nursing staff were fabulous with my niece, I can’t praise them enough. Kind, caring and completely engaging with her...she now wants to come back to work there. Thank you so much.

title: Fab Team
body: Harcourt has a friendly atmosphere and caring, supportive staff. Appointment requests are handled promptly and appropriately, prescription requests efficiently dealt with and excellent communication all round from admin and clinical staff. Thank you for your care and kindness.

title: New way of working.
body: Your new way of working is superb.  Filling in the form online was a breeze.  Lots more convenient for you to call me for a 10 min consultation than to take an afternoon off work to visit the surgery.  The ANP who called was very compassionate and understanding, and made me feel like an individual rather than a number, thank you.  My prescription was delivered to the pharmacy and I collected my medicine on my way home from work.  Lots easier to get to treatment now you are doing phone calls, thanks to all the team.

title: Prompt treatment
body: I wanted to thank my GP at Alma Road who called me back the same morning after I rang with concern about my child. He listened, gave careful advice to call back same day if there is further deterioration  and sent prescription directly to a local pharmacy. Within an hour we were able collect the medicine for my little one. My GP has always been very caring, compassionate and accessible when needed. Thank you for such top service even during the current pandemic.

title: Fantastic Ward ( East B1)
body:
Had shoulder replacement on 30th Oct 2020.
I stayed for 2 nights,and the staff were absolutely out this world. So helpful,friendly,and professional. From the nurses,both day and night shift,to the support staff that took great care and compassion for me. Was such an eye opener to find such caring people. Not as anyone wants to go to hospital,but if you do,East B1 is the place to be! Thankyou so much for looking after me.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service from everyone involved
body: Unwell with Shingles during COVID, I received excellent treatment. Great to use the eConsult service, professional and friendly reception staff, timely and accurate medical treatment. All done and dusted in just a couple of hours. Have subsequently been in to see the amazing practice nurse for my routine smear - reassured that they are protecting me against COVID whilst providing first class medical care despite the difficulties that they are all facing. And everyone with a smile too. I really cant say thank you enough Wembury!

title: World class emergency care received
body:
Hi

I am emailing to thank you for the excellent service I received in your emergency department yesterday afternoon Friday 30st October. I had a bad fall at the indoor ski centre in Castleford and knew I had really hurt myself as soon as I went over the jump and landed on my back. I was terrified as my hands went numb and I couldn’t move them at one point, I was convinced I was going to be paralysed as I work in Neuro and spinal trauma surgery so my mind was overthinking. 

It was the scariest moment of my life so far and I am just so grateful for our NHS, being on the other side is awful but makes me realise how amazing it really is. Please pass on my thanks to the staff who dealt with me, they were amazing, so professional showed excellent compassion in their individual practice and reassured me as I was in shock and rather hysterical thinking I was paralysed. I really can’t thank them enough. I had a CT and it was clear thank the lord so I am just taking it easy and when I ski again will not be doing any jumps what so ever and will be taking it very slowly.

Thank you again and keep up the amazing work you all do!

title: Slick Flu Jab process
body:
Had my annual flu jab on Sunday 1 November and was in and out in less than 5 minutes and never stood within 2 meters of another patient.

Friendly staff, on their game.

title: Thank You
body:
Had a heart attack on Tuesday 27/10/2020. 
First Responder, Ambulance Crew, A&E, Pilgrim Ward, Cath Lab and CCU were all excellent. Cannot fault them. All the staff were wonderful.
Discharge procedure on Thursday 29th was painfully slow. At 0700hrs I was washed and dressed and sat next to my bed waiting to go home. At 0900hrs Consultant said I could go home. The discharge procedure then creaked into action. NINE HOURS later I was still on the ward, waiting for Pharmacy, and effectively occupying a bedspace which could have been used for someone who needed it.
Your discharge procedure, especially the role played by Pharmacy, needs serious review.

title: Brilliant job under awful circumstances
body:
This surgery has been utterly brilliant over the course of this awful year.  Responsive, caring, efficient and helpful, whether it’s a clinical problem or an administrative change.  The whole team is friendly and professional. Given the unbelievable strain they’ve been under and the utterly ridiculous nonsense in the press about General Practice being closed (SPOILER: they’ve been open all the way through) they’ve performed brilliantly.

Thank you, everybody. Your hard work is very much appreciated.

title: Extremely concerning
body:
I was advised by a pharmacist to give 111 a call after my Surgery wouldn’t organise my repeat prescription. Got through to someone after listening to nearly Ten minutes of rhetoric about Covid. She asked me the normal questions, name, Dob, postcode (the usual stuff). Then she wanted to know my exact location. She seemed to think I was calling from a street in South London first. Then she wanted the house number I was calling from, I tried to explain I was out but she insisted on knowing the exact address. I tried explaining that I was trying to organise a repeat prescription but again, she insisted that she had to know exactly where I was. We’re they going to airdrop my medication to me?! 

In the end I got fed up of repeating myself and said I’d call my local practice back. Hung up the phone and they spent the next hour hounding me with call backs. 

I’ve never been asked for my exact location by 111 before, got concerned enough to think the call had been picked up by someone not in the 111 centre and told the Police. 

I’d recommend that Elderly or vulnerable callers have someone else call in to make sure they don’t accidentally part with bank details or other sensitive info.

title: Didn't think they could get any worse!
body: Dad was admitted. We were told he didn't have long. Transferred to a ward during the night. When we rang Ince ward the next morning we were told 'oh he's ok . Yes he's ok I think!' Couldn't tell me anything. We later found out that she was talking about the wrong person! Matron thought it was quite amusing that my dad was poorly but the other gentleman was fine! We eventually found him. Took me 4 hours of ringing to get through in the evening. From the conversation , they didn't know much about him or his to treat dementia patients (as I've noticed many times before). Next morning after 2 hours trying, told to ring back in half hour. Amazingly still trying after another 2 hours. They may be busy, but if we can't visit then they have to expect that very worried relatives will need an update. I would previously give Wigan Infirmary 3/10. Now it's 1/10.

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Awful service
body:
Baywater they should be renamed Slaywater! They have left my husband who has very severe c.o.p.d with very little oxygen for all over weekend. It states on their website order friday for saturday delivery, sunday for monday delivery etc. I rung friday for delivery on saturday to be told we would have to wait until monday. I explained what it stated about delivery times on their website & that as it was their fault could I have portable bottles. No was the answer not unless I get a hoof from the oxygen nurse. I phoned the oxygen nurse who doesn’t work friday, saturday or sunday so that was an impossibility. 
They said their website only applies to Wales but nowhere on it does it state that the North West is excluded. My husband will now spend the weekend sitting on the settee trying to conserve oxygen thanks to Slaywater as if his life isn’t hard enough. Where is their customer care?? Enhancing lives through their outstanding Healthcare is one of their statements so when is it going to start then Slaywater?????? Where is your compassion? So unhelpful.

title: Pointless
body: Since the Covid-19 virus, all my appointments have been over the phone even when lockdown restrictions were lifted. Absolutely ridicul8when my condition needs to be looked at. This hospital is just there for show. No accident or emergency department. My elderly parents when I'll have had to endure the journey to Kingsmill Mansfield. Pointless there even being a hospital there. Not sure what the staff here get paid to do but they seem to have an easy life compared to 'proper hospitals.'

title: unhelpful
body: my 86 yr old mum was on chestnut and staff could not do enough.  she was moved to rosewood and the difference is astounding.  The staff are rude and unhelpful.  They will not allow me to talk to mum,  I understand that I cannot visit because of covid,  but to isolate an 86 yr old is inhuman.  When I asked about her, they just said yes what about her, how rude.

title: Fantastic care
body: I was ran out of my prescription and called the receptionist who was very helpful and sorted out my problem quickly. I have been registered at this practice for 14 years and have always had excellent care. They adapted to the challenges of Covid quickly and smoothly in order to continue looking after me and my family in a safe way. Thank you from the bottom of my heart to all of the staff at Southfields Group Practice.

title: Good experience
body: I’ve always been able to get an appointment, either on the day urgent or planned in advance. Even during COVID Shaw Heath and Bramhall have worked flexibly and safely and I’ve had 1 quick and easy telephone consultation, and have had my smear done in a Covid safe manner. Really good service.

title: Efficient service to get repeat prescription
body: I completed an online consultation and got a call bank within 30 minutes to tell me my repeat prescription had been sent to the chemist.

title: Needing fortnightly blood tests
body: I have been asked to book fortnightly blood tests by my Rheumatologist as I’ve recently been diagnosed with Dermatomyositis and am on prednisolone & methotrexate. In spite of emailing and making numerous phone calls, I have been unable to book suitable tests because either the appointments are not yet online or are not pre-bookable or are already booked out. Why is it so difficult to book a routine fortnightly bunch of blood tests? How on earth do the elderly/infirm cope with this situation? The staff at the Hedon practices all look absolutely knackered and at the end of their tether. This is not good enough. Both your patients and staff are suffering. The CEO and their team needs to address these useless systems immediately, so that the doctors, nurses, pharmacists and admin staff can be enabled to work more efficiently and effectively.

title: Compassionate and efficient
body: Had a prebooked routine review appointment but a more urgent problem cropped up on the day. I only expected the urgent problem to be dealt with but both were dealt with quickly and efficiently. Otherwise all staff have been lovely. Reception team/prescriptions/appointment booking a bit old fashioned and had some errors in types of appointment booked etc but all sorted out once errors spotted.

title: Sanderson Suite Day Case
body: I wanted to leave this review to thank all the staff who cared for me during my day case surgery at the Sanderson Suite. I was really nervous and worried but everyone explained things carefully worked hard and efficiently while i was there. I felt like I could ask questions and safe. It really made a huge difference that everyone was caring and professional. Thankyou for working so hard to make my experience as positive as possible.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Great GP
body: Really a very good service. My GP was interested, helpful, listened and got things done. I had recently moved to this practice from another and the difference was incredible.

title: Fantastic Doctors, Very Helpful.
body: Thank you William Harvey Surgery Doctors, Nurses and Staff. The surgery has always been helpful to myself and family when we have required it. Prompt answering of queries and excellent care. During the pandemic they have been able to help via email. They are very much still open for business and will speak to you on the phone and even see you face to face if your condition requires it. Thank you!

title: Very professional
body: Went for Flu jab and they saw that I was due. Pneumonia jab so did it the same time this saved me a second visit and them using up another appointment.

title: Tip Top
body: I have been registered at this practice for 5 years, every time I have contact, they have been kind, caring and efficient.  Had reason to attend an appt during Covid Gp was amazing and staff stayed late to see if I needed any meds before I left.  The patient service is exceptional.  Thank you to the whole team.

title: Great staff, great practice
body: I have been registered at the practice for the last 5 years and had 2 children in that time. I have had no issues with the practice at all, easy to make an appointment with doctor first triage, easy to request medication online. The practice has adapted to current covid-restrictions well and I have felt very safe when needing to use the practice services during this challenging time. We are lucky to have such a dedicated team of doctors and nurses in our community.

title: Great care received
body: I have had three consultations via econsult in the last 6 weeks for both myself and my children. I have had very prompt and professional care and would definitely recommend lakeside surgery. Thank you for all your hard work.

title: Brilliant service ( Anaesthetics/ Theatre)
body: Had a shoulder replacement 30th Oct2020,and the Anaethetist,and theatre staff where absolutely fantastic. Talked and shown me every step of the procedure, made me at ease,and great conversation. So friendly,polite,and proffessional. Thankyou so much,and obviously the surgeon for doing such a fantastic job.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice but many recent problems
body:
Since the long term GP retired there have been many problems.
You can no longer book appointments in advance and now have to try and call the surgery at 8am to secure an appointment that day. This procedure was at one time for urgent cases or emergencies only, and for a small handful of slots, but has now become the norm. 
A new telephone system makes it virtually impossible to speak to the surgery - you can make numerous calls over a number of days before you are able to get through to reception. By which point the appointments have already gone and you are told to try again the following day. There is no answer machine or facility to leave a voice message. 
The practices website is no longer available.
The surgery pushed Patient Access and other apps but now this seems to be a way of requesting repeat prescriptions only. You can no longer book appointments using this method. The practice should consider using the Messaging facility on Patient Access which may alleviate the constant, repeat telephone calls and patient frustration at not being able to speak to anyone for a number of days.
Getting an actual appointment with a GP is now a rarity - at best you are promised a call back which tends to come from Nurse-led areas rather than a Doctor. Callbacks are promised but no times given. One call is attempted, from a withheld number, and no message is left so if you miss the call you cannot contact the Doctor/Nurse and then have to start the whole process again the following day.
Its a shame as this was a really good practice with good staff but modernising services has not been for the benefit of the patient at all.

title: Thankyou
body: I had some personal issues and was offered a prompt telephone appointment. This suited perfectly and was able to discuss my issues easily. I was offered a face to face follow up and treatment and an onward referral was made. The Gp was professional, prompt and kind. Thanks for all your doing. Much appreciated!

title: Great practice
body: The various receptionists were welcoming very helpful & efficient so too the pharmacy staff plus I I got good value for money on item purchaesd. Asthma nurse and all 4 Doctors all of them first class, I felt very cared for from beginning to end of my journey. Reception and toilet was stopless on my 4 visits and helpful literature provided. I was treated with respect and dignity, listened to, solutions found and guidance made very clear. I am enormously grateful thank you.

title: Lack of discharge information distressing.
body: My son was taken to A&E following a seizure, as he’s on the Autistic spectrum I traveled with him too the hospital. On arrival due to covid 19 i was not allowed to be with him in the examination room following further restrictions being announced to be implemented the next week. So far, reasonable and measured. The failure on the day was the lack of information given on his discharge from A&E, only a prescription and a requirement to contact our GP service regarding a referral to a seizure clinic. No mention on what the medication was for, what his test results were or any mention of what might have caused the event. On the other hand the paramedics were very informative on arrival during transport to the hospital and after arrival. Hope the GP service can be more informative.

title: Great practice, very efficient
body:
I’ve been registered with this surgery for six years.
I’m fortunate that my family and I enjoy good health, however when I have needed to consult a GP, I have never had any difficulty getting an appointment. 
Latterly then surgery had had to change the way it works in line with the rest of the country, to keep patients and staff safe during the pandemic. Recently I filled in an e-consultation about a long-term condition on a Sunday afternoon and there was a prescription at my pharmacy by Monday morning (despite me making it clear m bed wasn’t urgent). 
Super efficient service all round!

title: Excellent care
body: Recently my Brother was admitted with Covid19 and has since sadly passed away. I would like to express my sincere thanks to all staff on Chestnut ward for the excellent care he received. Also for the way  the doctor's and nurses kept me informed of his condition every step of the way as I was in self isolation myself. Thank you all for your caring, friendly and professional attitude. Thank you from all our family.

title: Safe and efficient
body: I recently had to attend for a nursing appointment and was very impressed by the system they have implemented to ensure social distancing is adhered to. All the staff were friendly and efficient. Keep up the good work!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Outstanding care
body:
I have been a patient at Shepley for the last 5 years and have had outstanding service throughout this time, despite the challenges of Covid. The whole team (doctors, nursing team and admin) are kind, compassionate and demonstrate the utmost in professionalism. 
Thank you all

title: Excellent patient care
body: I filled in the online self referral form and despite missing their call back the next day, received an email saying that they had booked me an appointment 2 working days later which I was very impressed by. The doctor was friendly and professional and put me at ease. They organised a scan which happened 3 days after my initial consultation. The communication at every stage was excellent. Due to the current coronavirus situation I was concerned that things might be delayed but all the staff at the surgery were very efficient and everything was sorted more quickly than I would have expected outside a pandemic. Very impressive.

title: Pretty Poor Administration
body: Find the level of customer service to be lacking, staff appear to take a not-my-job type of approach always passing over to someone else. I have been given the deep-sigh attitude by the reception staff, when you or someone is ill, unwell or suicidal as I was, its not really what you want to hear down the phone.

author: Bloom
title: Meadow view surgery
body: Extremely unfriendly and don’t seem to care. That goes for all of the staff I have encountered at the practice. In my opinion they are not good at communicating with their patients and don’t chase up to find how things are especially if you are having ongoing treatment. I am so disappointed with the practice on so many levels. Trying to call to book for an appointment is a nightmare, phone is always busy. I once call from 8: 30am and the phone was busy so I drove down and kept ringing and when I got there and got to reception the phone receiver was off the phone and you just think to yourself -is this for real? I wish I could move my family and myself away from there but where we want to go is oversubscribed!

author: Forstesh
title: Covid complications and recovery
body:
I was referred into the acute GP service yesterday. Firstly can I say this was prompt work from my GP to see me in a 'hot bay' clinic having been Covid positive 18 days ago and get me straight into the hospital.  
The staff met me with a smile and kind reassuring words. They arranged tests, bloods firstly as they knew they'd be an hour in the lab (only 1hr! ! ) Then onto sats, ECG, an Dr Moon examination of my chest. Then off for chest xray, I didnt even get to sit down it was that quick and straight back to Dr Moon for results.  
A further smile, gentle explanation and refer for CT. I cant have been waiting there for 10minutes when called in promptly by a radiologist who quickly and professionally identified my cannula was not in the vein but in 'tissue'. He placed another effortlessly and CT scan completed.  
While all this was going on inside the hospital, outside my husband and 3yr old waiting for me had toilet issues (we rushed out of the house with nothing in hand and no thoughts they were not allowed in the building due to Covid restrictions) and when the staff overheard my conversation offered wipes and continence pad for my daughter if needed! Talk about over and above!  
Dawn and Dr moon were amazing. Luckily the car had some supplies to help the little girls accident. I was then given results, the explanation thorough and comprehensive. I felt in awe, such wonderful, prompt, amazing care from start to finish. What I felt could have been improved was the clinic areas/environments these amazing people have to work in. Clearly a great service, shoe-horned into old office space, so when I nearly fainted having my canula inserted the first time, I was unable to lie on a couch as the clinic rooms were in use by another service. The constraints of a critical service evident. These clinicians are making the best of what they have been given but must be disheartened to know what they do is let down by the environment they've been provided. I hope RCHT can find these wonderful services and staff the facilities they clearly deserve.  
I would like xray and CT to know they were amazing, prompt and professional. I would also like Dawn and Dr Moon to know how amazing they are, how they made an awful day tolerable with a smile and giggle along the way. And I'd love RCHT to be bigger, if more clinic rooms are needed for these essential services. But mainly, a massive THANK YOU for being there at all and working amazingly with what you've got.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Wendy2222
title: Once chance GP call
body:
I made an appointment to have a call from GP. I was told tomorrow the GP would call. I wasn't given a time for my call, nor was I told, when making my appointment, If I didn't answer the call. They don't call back and your appointment is cancelled. I was working and in a situation, where I was unable to take the call, when the GP rang.  
I called the surgery to be told very curtly the GP had moved on. But they would tell the GP I'd called. I also emailed in as I was still in need of treatment. No call came. So I called again on the Friday to be told I can't make an appointment until Monday...  
I feel frustrated, disregarded and that the surgery I entrust with my health care I feel couldn't give a monkeys about me. I'm not a frequent caller. So also feel that the GP would know, I only make appointments that I need I could have been offered a second call, especially after I called and emailed... I feel like a number and a nuisance.  
I was made to feel like I was to blame. Saying well you've had your call... Regardless of reason for not answering... Even if I'd been in the loo, I should answer the call... And no one gets a time for the call... Its random, anytime throughout the day...  
Totally disregarding people's personal circumstances...

author: Jent1990
title: Pain management for my cyst
body:
The cyst started to become painful and I saw Dr Park, She sent me to Homerton Hospital for potential surgery as the cyst had become an abscess and had inoculated.  
A&E said that they were going to assess me there rather than sending me to gynae. They tested my blood and sent me away with some antibiotics . At this point I was struggling to walk as the abscess was around the size of a golf ball and the pain had stopped being a dull ache and was more like a white hot, sharp pain. The pain got progressively worse throughout the day to the point where I struggled to go to the toilet as the movement of sitting down created too much pain.  
I had some pain-relief that the hospital had given previously. I started taking this as well as ibuprofen. I don’t normally take painkillers unless I’m struggling to manage period pains. The painkillers did help slightly with the pain but I couldn’t really move around without any pain. If I lay in the right position I could stop the pain. It felt like a nerve pain.  
I spoke to someone on the 111 line 5am as I had woken up from a night of interrupted sleep with intense stomach cramps. They reassured me and said it was probably from the medication and told me to make sure I ate more whilst taking the tablets. The next 48 hours are a bit blurry but I had a few calls with the GP and then 111 as I was struggling to manage the pain.  
I always consider myself to have a high pain threshold but this was quite difficult to manage.Early morning a few days later it got really bad when I was trying to go for a wee and I thought I was going to be sick. I was refused additional Pain-relief that afternoon by another GP which I found a bit difficult because I was in so much pain. I do understand this was because codeine is addictive but I was definitely running out of stamina by this point.  
Luckily, on that night the abscess ruptured and a lot of red, thick liquid came out. The sharp, hot pain dropped off within minutes and I could walk upright again. There was another burst of liquid at around 2am which happened as I was opening my bowels. The pain came back but then subsided quite quickly. Over the weekend the pain continued to subside and I was able to walk again. I have finished the course of antibiotics and now have an acorn sized lump which I am continuing to bathe.  
Dr Park told me to continue to bathe it and to not have intercourse until the puncture wound has healed. This is probably the worst thing that has happened to me from a medical point of view. I guess I’m lucky really! I did find it very difficult to manage the pain and I think because I was told by A&E that it’d start to improve after 24 hours and it took about 60 hours for my pain to subside I struggled.  
Also, nobody who I spoke to once I was in pain really asked me what the pain was like or how bad it was so I have no perception of whether what I was feeling was normal for a bartholin abscess. Other than this feedback, everyone I spoke to was really great and very supportive. I’m very grateful for the care that I received. This week I feel like a new person!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Homerton University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
